name: Greek Chicken Power Bowl
description: Mediterranean flavors packed into a protein-rich bowl. Featuring tzatziki sauce, feta cheese, and olives.

instructions.instruction: Rinse quinoa and cook with 2 cups water for 15 minutes.
Make marinade: Mix 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Make tzatziki: Mix yogurt, minced garlic, remaining lemon juice, 1 tbsp olive oil, and mint.
instructions.tip: Strained yogurt gives the best consistency.

instructions.instruction: Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side. Internal temp should reach 74°C (165°F).
Rest chicken for 5 minutes, then slice into strips.
Fluff cooked quinoa and divide into bowls.
Arrange cucumber, tomatoes, onion, and olives on the quinoa.
Add sliced chicken and crumble feta over top.
Drizzle with tzatziki and remaining olive oil.

tips: Mediterranean diet is ideal for heart health.
Feta cheese is a good source of calcium.
Perfect for meal prep - store sauce separately for up to 4 days.
Bowls can be prepared ahead and taken to work.
storageInfo: Store sauce separately. Keeps for 4 days refrigerated.
servingSuggestion: Serve with pita bread or whole wheat lavash.
variations: Lamb skewers can be used instead of chicken.
Use falafel and plant-based yogurt for a vegan version.
Add grilled peppers for extra vegetables.
